title: The difference between the compound interest and simple interest on a certain sum for 2 years at 7.5% per annum is Rs 360. What is the sum? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let X be the sum. 2 years compound Interest can be written as: CI = X (1 + 7.5/100)^2 CI = 1.075^2 X CI = 1.155625 X 2 years Simple Interest can be written as: SI = X + 2 * X * 7.5/100 SI = X + 0.15 X SI = 1.15 X — (ii) Now, we know that, CI - SI = 360 — (iii) Substituting, equations (i) & (ii) in (iii), we have, 1.155625 X - 1.15 X = 360 0.005625 X = 360 X = 360/0.005625 X = 64000. So, the sum is Rs. 64,000/-.
